subject: Mental Health
title: Lithium: Nature's Mood Stabilizer
description: A 60-second lesson on Lithium: Nature's Mood Stabilizer.

hook.text: A simple element from the periodic table turned out to tame bipolar disorder.

buildup.text: John Cade discovered lithium's calming effects in 1949 while studying guinea pigs.

discovery.text: Lithium reduces manic episodes and is still the gold standard for bipolar disorder.

twist.text: It took 21 years for the FDA to approve it because no one could patent an element.

climax.text: Lithium reduces suicide risk more than any other psychiatric medication.

punchline.text: Sometimes the best medicine is already on the periodic table.

quiz.question: Why did lithium take 21 years to get FDA approval?
options: No one could patent a natural element, reducing profit incentive
